assume.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to think that something is true, although you do not have definite proof
assume.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: It seems reasonable to assume that the book was written around 70 AD.
I think we can safely assume that interest rates will go up again soon.
Let us assume for a moment that we could indeed fire her. Should we?
When it got to midnight and Paul was still not back, I began to assume the worst.
I didn’t see your car, so I assumed you’d gone out.
The rest of the system is assumed to be functioning well.
somebody/something is assumed to be (doing) something
assume.translation[0].definitions[0].not: In more formal English, you say it is assumed that something is true
It is assumed that the person is innocent
assume.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to start to have a particular quality or appearance
assume.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: These relationships assume great importance in times of crisis.
The problem is beginning to assume massive proportions.
assume.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to be based on the idea that something else is correct
assume.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Coen’s economic forecast assumes a 3.5% growth rate.
The theory assumes that both labour and capital are mobile.
